Window.BasicDrawDevice.onDisplayRotate

Function/Meaning
When the display is rotated (1.1.0 or later)
Type
Event of the Window.BasicDrawDevice class
Syntax
onDisplayRotate(orientation, angle, bpp, width, height)
Arguments
orientation The display orientation.
It will be one of the following values:
oriUnknown (Failed to get/Unknown), oriPortrait (Portrait), oriLandscape (Landscape)
angle The angle.
The angle is one of 0, 90, 180, 270, or -1. It will be -1 if it could not be retrieved.
The angle is the rotation angle from the device's default, so on a portrait-oriented device, portrait is 0.
On typical devices, landscape is often 0.
Portrait being 0 occurs on recent 8-inch tablets and similar devices where portrait is the standard orientation.
bpp Bits per pixel.
width The width of the display.
height The height of the display.
Description
Represents the event function called when the display is rotated.
Reference
Window.onDisplayRotate
Window.displayOrientation
Window.displayRotate
